Purchase Order No: 2200009658 Dated : 31-JUL-2017

General Instructions
1. Receipt of goods from Monday to Saturday from 8.00 AM to 5.00 PM or as agreed upon.
2. The invoice material description should be same as our purchase order material description.
3. Quantity supplied by you should not exceed the quantity mentioned in the purchase order.
4. Please quote purchase order number and date in all your correspondence.
5. Our bankers address: State bank Of Hyderabad, PMR complex, Opp to Corporation office, Tirupati-5 17507, Ph-0877-220153.
6. In case of Excisable goods, Excise gate pass should be sent along with material.
7. Supplier should ensure that material supplied confirms to statutory & regulatory requirements.
8. Supplier should acknowledge receipt of purchase order and agreement of terms mentioned in purchase order. It is considered that all
purchase order terms are accepted unless otherwise specified in writing by the supplier with in seven days.
9. If the item is age-sensitive the supplier shall clearly mention the date of manufacturing and shelf-life. The available shelf-life shall be
more than 50% of material shelf-life from the date of dispatch.
10. In case of any denial/disallowance of Cenvat/Service tax credit and any penalty and/or interest on account of improper documents
from the vendor shall be borne by the vendor only.
11. Purchase or number and line serial number should be mentioned in the Invoice.
12. Our contact person should be informed of the date of dispatch of the material one day in advance.
13. Invoice number should be mentioned in all test reports.
14. Material should be packed in proper packing method as agreed.
15. The consignor need to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Central
Motor Vehicle Rules, 1989 and there after amendments - specifically pertaining to transportation of goods of dangerous or hazardous
nature to human life from Rule 129 to 137.
16. The consignor needs to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Gas
Cylinder Rules, 2004 and there after amendments specifically pertaining to general provisions under chapter II from Rule 3 to 28.
17. All the transport vehicles need to comply to the emission norms specified by Central Motor Vehicle Rules, 189 and need to obtain
renewed emission certificate issued by the competent authority.
18. All the transport vehicles in Amara Raja premises should follow the traffic rules strictly and the speed limit should be less than
20kmph.
19. Electronic Way Bill (e-Way Bill) is mandatory for all Interstate purchase transactions. Please get e -Way Bill from buyers before
dispatch the material through online by providing the necessary details and Amara Raja is not responsible for any material struck in CTO
office / on the way to Amara Raja.

2. The invoice material description should be same as our purchase order material description.
3. Quantity supplied by you should not exceed the quantity mentioned in the purchase order.
4. Please quote purchase order number and date in all your correspondence.
5. Our bankers address: State bank Of Hyderabad, PMR complex, Opp to Corporation office, Tirupati-5 17507, Ph-0877-220153.
6. In case of Excisable goods, Excise gate pass should be sent along with material.
7. Supplier should ensure that material supplied confirms to statutory & regulatory requirements.
8. Supplier should acknowledge receipt of purchase order and agreement of terms mentioned in purchase order. It is considered that all
purchase order terms are accepted unless otherwise specified in writing by the supplier with in seven days.
9. If the item is age-sensitive the supplier shall clearly mention the date of manufacturing and shelf-life. The available shelf-life shall be
more than 50% of material shelf-life from the date of dispatch.
10. In case of any denial/disallowance of Cenvat/Service tax credit and any penalty and/or interest on account of improper documents
from the vendor shall be borne by the vendor only.
11. Purchase or number and line serial number should be mentioned in the Invoice.
12. Our contact person should be informed of the date of dispatch of the material one day in advance.
13. Invoice number should be mentioned in all test reports.
14. Material should be packed in proper packing method as agreed.
15. The consignor need to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Central
Motor Vehicle Rules, 1989 and there after amendments - specifically pertaining to transportation of goods of dangerous or hazardous
nature to human life from Rule 129 to 137.
16. The consignor needs to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Gas
Cylinder Rules, 2004 and there after amendments specifically pertaining to general provisions under chapter II from Rule 3 to 28.
17. All the transport vehicles need to comply to the emission norms specified by Central Motor Vehicle Rules, 189 and need to obtain
renewed emission certificate issued by the competent authority.
18. All the transport vehicles in Amara Raja premises should follow the traffic rules strictly and the speed limit should be less than
20kmph.
19. Electronic Way Bill (e-Way Bill) is mandatory for all Interstate purchase transactions. Please get e -Way Bill from buyers before
dispatch the material through online by providing the necessary details and Amara Raja is not responsible for any material struck in CTO
office / on the way to Amara Raja.

Purchase Order No: 1300008586 Dated : 05-OCT-2018

General Instructions:
1. Receipt of goods from Monday to Saturday from 8.00 AM to 5.00 PM or as agreed upon.
. The invoice material description should be same as our purchase order material description.
. Quantity supplied by you should not exceed the quantity mentioned in the purchase order.
4. Please quote purchase order number and date in all your correspondence.
5. Our bankers address: State bank Of Hyderabad, PMR complex, Opp to Corporation office, Tirupati-5 17507, Ph-0877-220153.
6. In case of Excisable goods, Excise gate pass should be sent along with material.
7. Supplier should ensure that material supplied confirms to statutory & regulatory requirements.
8. Supplier should acknowledge receipt of purchase order and agreement of terms mentioned in purchase order. It is considered that all

purchase order terms are accepted unless otherwise specified in writing by the supplier with in seven days.

9. If the item is age-sensitive the supplier shall clearly mention the date of manufacturing and shelf-life. The available shelf-life shall be
more than 50% of material shelf-life from the date of dispatch.
10. In case of any denial/disallowance of Cenvat/Service tax credit and any penalty and/or interest on account of improper documents
from the vendor shall be borne by the vendor only.
11. Purchase or number and line serial number should be mentioned in the Invoice.
12. Our contact person should be informed of the date of dispatch of the material one day in advance.
13. Invoice number should be mentioned in all test reports.
14. Material should be packed in proper packing method as agreed.
15. The consignor need to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Central
Motor Vehicle Rules, 1989 and there after amendments - specifically pertaining to transportation of goods of dangerous or hazardous
nature to human life from Rule 129 to 137.
16. The consignor needs to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Gas
Cylinder Rules, 2004 and there after amendments specifically pertaining to general provisions under chapter II from Rule 3 to 28.
17. All the transport vehicles need to comply to the emission norms specified by Central Motor Vehicle Rules, 189 and need to obtain
renewed emission certificate issued by the competent authority.
18. All the transport vehicles in Amara Raja premises should follow the traffic rules strictly and the speed limit should be less than
20kmph.
19. Electronic Way Bill (e-Way Bill) is mandatory for all Interstate purchase transactions. Please get e -Way Bill from buyers before
dispatch the material through online by providing the necessary details and Amara Raja is not responsible for any material struck in CTO
office / on the way to Amara Raja.

Order Accepted

For MAINI MATERIALS MOVEMENT PVT. LTD. For AMARA RAJA BATTERIES LIMITE

1. Receipt of goods from Monday to Saturday from 8.00 AM to 5.00 PM or as agreed upon.
. The invoice material description should be same as our purchase order material description.
. Quantity supplied by you should not exceed the quantity mentioned in the purchase order.
. Please quote purchase order number and date in all your correspondence.
. Our bankers address: State bank Of Hyderabad, PMR complex, Opp to Corporation office, Tirupati-5 17507, Ph-0877-220153.
6. In case of Excisable goods, Excise gate pass should be sent along with material.
7. Supplier should ensure that material supplied confirms to statutory & regulatory requirements.
8. Supplier should acknowledge receipt of purchase order and agreement of terms mentioned in purchase order. It is considered that all

purchase order terms are accepted unless otherwise specified in writing by the supplier with in seven days.

9. If the item is age-sensitive the supplier shall clearly mention the date of manufacturing and shelf-life. The available shelf-life shall be
more than 50% of material shelf-life from the date of dispatch.
10. In case of any denial/disallowance of Cenvat/Service tax credit and any penalty and/or interest on account of improper documents
from the vendor shall be borne by the vendor only.
11. Purchase or number and line serial number should be mentioned in the Invoice.
12. Our contact person should be informed of the date of dispatch of the material one day in advance.
13. Invoice number should be mentioned in all test reports.
14. Material should be packed in proper packing method as agreed.
15. The consignor need to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Central
Motor Vehicle Rules, 1989 and there after amendments - specifically pertaining to transportation of goods of dangerous or hazardous
nature to human life from Rule 129 to 137.
16. The consignor needs to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Gas
Cylinder Rules, 2004 and there after amendments specifically pertaining to general provisions under chapter II from Rule 3 to 28.
17. All the transport vehicles need to comply to the emission norms specified by Central Motor Vehicle Rules, 189 and need to obtain
renewed emission certificate issued by the competent authority.
18. All the transport vehicles in Amara Raja premises should follow the traffic rules strictly and the speed limit should be less than
20kmph.
19. Electronic Way Bill (e-Way Bill) is mandatory for all Interstate purchase transactions. Please get e -Way Bill from buyers before
dispatch the material through online by providing the necessary details and Amara Raja is not responsible for any material struck in CTO
office / on the way to Amara Raja.

Order Accepted

For Electrocoating & Insulation Technologies, For AMARA RAJA BATTERIES LIMITED

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

1, The Carrier will not receive or accept for carriage, gold, silver, jewellery, Precious stones, securities, valubale documentsand other types of precious and/ or valuable goods and the staff or agents of carrier are not authorized ta receive oraccept any such

2 gonads for carriage, ifany such gocas are accepted and/or booked for carriage, inadvertently or otherwise, the carrier wiii be under no responsibility whatsoever in respect thereof.

5.

time of arrival of the conveyance at the destination whichever shall occur first. Thereafter, the goods remain entirely at the risk of owners and neither the carrier nor its insurer (s) shall be responsible or liable for loss or damage to and/or destruction of such

goods.

Demurrage will be charged @ 1 Rs. per kg/day if delivery of goods is not taken by the consignee(s) after expiry of 4 daysfrom date of arrival of goods at destination.

ordinary breakage, leakace, insufficiently of packing, inadequacy of make or any accident however arising

TERMS & CONDITIONS OF SALE

Breakages/ Shortages etc. if any, must be reported immediately on receipt

of goods.
Goods once sold will not be taken back unless specifically agreed to by us.

Interest on overdue accounts will be charged at the prevailing commercial
rate.

No refund of GST and/or other taxes of any kind will be made if not claimed
before such taxes are paid to the authorities. On assessment of GST and/
or other taxes on this transaction, in the future, additional taxes levied by
the authorities will be to your account.

For goods despatched through the Buyer's carrier, our risk/responsibility
ceases when the goods are handed over to the carrier.

All disputes are subject to Delhi Jurisdiction only.

Text:
Purchase Order No: 1100088099 Dated : 17-JUL-2018

General Instructions:

1. Receipt of goods from Monday to Saturday from 8.00 AM to 5.00 PM or as agreed upon.

2. The invoice material description should be same as our purchase order material description.

3. Quantity supplied by you should not exceed the quantity mentioned in the purchase order.

4. Please quote purchase order number and date in all your correspondence.

5. Our bankers address: State bank Of Hyderabad, PMR complex, Opp to Corporation office, Tirupati-517507, Ph-0877-220153.

6. In case of Excisable goods, Excise gate pass should be sent along with material.

7. Supplier should ensure that material supplied confirms to statutory & regulatory requirements.

8. Supplier should acknowledge receipt of purchase order and agreement of terms mentioned in purchase order. It is considered that all
purchase order terms are accepted unless otherwise specified in writing by the supplier with in seven days.

9. If the item is age-sensitive the supplier shall clearly mention the date of manufacturing and shelf-life. The available shelf-life shall be
more than 50% of material shelf-life from the date of dispatch.

10. In case of any denial/disallowance of Cenvat/Service tax credit and any penalty and/or interest on account of improper documents
from the vendor shall be borne by the vendor only.

11. Purchase or number and line serial number should be mentioned in the Invoice.

12. Our contact person should be informed of the date of dispatch of the material one day in advance.

13. Invoice number should be mentioned in all test reports.

14. Material should be packed in proper packing method as agreed.

15. The consignor need to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Central
Motor Vehicle Rules, 1989 and there after amendments - specifically pertaining to transportation of goods of dangerous or hazardous

nature to human life from Rule 129 to 137.
16. The consignor needs to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Gas
Cylinder Rules, 2004 and there after amendments specifically pertaining to general provisions under chapter II from Rule 3 to 28.
17. All the transport vehicles need to comply to the emission norms specified by Central Motor Vehicle Rules, 189 and need to obtain
renewed emission certificate issued by the competent authority.
18. All the transport vehicles in Amara Raja premises should follow the traffic rules strictly and the speed limit should be less than
20kmph.
19. Electronic Way Bill (e-Way Bill) is mandatory for all Interstate purchase transactions. Please get e -Way Bill from buyers before
dispatch the material through online by providing the necessary details and Amara Raja is not responsible for any material struck in CTO
office / on the way to Amara Raja.

Order Accepted

For COOKSON INDIA LTD. For AMARA RAJA BATTERIES LIMITED

uthorized Signatory Authorized Signatory

 

E&OE (Subject to Tirupati Jurisdiction)

PUR-SFS-07 Client ID : 300 System ID : BTDT1677TR1704 Login ID : 1007834 Run Date & Time: 28.12.2018 & 12:08:27 Page : 2 OF 2

Purchase Order No: 1100090630 Dated : 20-SEP-2018

General Instructions:

. Receipt of goods from Monday to Saturday from 8.00 AM to 5.00 PM or as agreed upon.

. The invoice material description should be same as our purchase order material description.

. Quantity supplied by you should not exceed the quantity mentioned in the purchase order.

. Please quote purchase order number and date in all your correspondence.

. Our bankers address: State bank Of Hyderabad, PMR complex, Opp to Corporation office, Tirupati-5 17507, Ph-0877-220153.

. In case of Excisable goods, Excise gate pass should be sent along with material.

. Supplier should ensure that material supplied confirms to statutory & regulatory requirements.

. Supplier should acknowledge receipt of purchase order and agreement of terms mentioned in purchase order. It is considered that all
purchase order terms are accepted unless otherwise specified in writing by the supplier with in seven days.
9. Ifthe item is age-sensitive the supplier shall clearly mention the date of manufacturing and shelf-life. The available shelf-life shall be
more than 50% of material shelf-life from the date of dispatch.
10. In case of any denial/disallowance of Cenvat/Service tax credit and any penalty and/or interest on account of improper documents
from the vendor shall be borne by the vendor only.
11. Purchase or number and line serial number should be mentioned in the Invoice.
12. Our contact person should be informed of the date of dispatch of the material one day in advance.
13. Invoice number should be mentioned in all test reports.
14. Material should be packed in proper packing method as agreed.
15. The consignor need to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Central
Motor Vehicle Rules, 1989 and there after amendments - specifically pertaining to transportation of goods of dangerous or hazardous
nature to human life from Rule 129 to 137.
16. The consignor needs to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Gas
Cylinder Rules, 2004 and there after amendments specifically pertaining to general provisions under chapter II from Rule 3 to 28.
17. All the transport vehicles need to comply to the emission norms specified by Central Motor Vehicle Rules, 189 and need to obtain
renewed emission certificate issued by the competent authority.
18. All the transport vehicles in Amara Raja premises should follow the traffic rules strictly and the speed limit should be less than
20kmph.
19. Electronic Way Bill (e-Way Bill) is mandatory for all Interstate purchase transactions. Please get e -Way Bill from buyers before
dispatch the material through online by providing the necessary details and Amara Raja is not responsible for any material struck in CTO
office / on the way to Amara Raja.

Order Accepted
For COOKSON INDIA LTD. For AMARA RAJA BATTERIES LIMITED

Purchase Order No: 1100089567 Dated : 25-AUG-2018

General Instructions:
. Receipt of goods from Monday to Saturday from 8.00 AM to 5.00 PM or as agreed upon.
. The invoice material description should be same as our purchase order material description.

. Quantity supplied by you should not exceed the quantity mentioned in the purchase order.

. Please quote purchase order number and date in all your correspondence.

. Our bankers address: State bank Of Hyderabad, PMR complex, Opp to Corporation office, Tirupati-5 17507, Ph-0877-220153.

. In case of Excisable goods, Excise gate pass should be sent along with material.

. Supplier should ensure that material supplied confirms to statutory & regulatory requirements.

. Supplier should acknowledge receipt of purchase order and agreement of terms mentioned in purchase order. It is considered that all

purchase order terms are accepted unless otherwise specified in writing by the supplier with in seven days.
9. If the item is age-sensitive the supplier shall clearly mention the date of manufacturing and shelf-life. The available shelf-life shall be
more than 50% of material shelf-life from the date of dispatch.
10. In case of any denial/disallowance of Cenvat/Service tax credit and any penalty and/or interest on account of improper documents
from the vendor shall be borne by the vendor only.
11. Purchase or number and line serial number should be mentioned in the Invoice.
12. Our contact person should be informed of the date of dispatch of the material one day in advance.
13. Invoice number should be mentioned in all test reports.
14. Material should be packed in proper packing method as agreed.
15. The consignor need to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Central
Motor Vehicle Rules, 1989 and there after amendments - specifically pertaining to transportation of goods of dangerous or hazardous
nature to human life from Rule 129 to 137.
16. The consignor needs to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Gas
Cylinder Rules, 2004 and there after amendments specifically pertaining to general provisions under chapter II from Rule 3 to 28.
17. All the transport vehicles need to comply to the emission norms specified by Central Motor Vehicle Rules, 189 and need to obtain
renewed emission certificate issued by the competent authority.
18. All the transport vehicles in Amara Raja premises should follow the traffic rules strictly and the speed limit should be less than
20kmph.
19. Electronic Way Bill (e-Way Bill) is mandatory for all Interstate purchase transactions. Please get e -Way Bill from buyers before
dispatch the material through online by providing the necessary details and Amara Raja is not responsible for any material struck in CTO
office / on the way to Amara Raja.

Order Accepted

For COOKSON INDIA LTD. For AMARA RAJA BATTERIES LIMITED

Authorized Signatory . Authorized Signatory

Text:
The products and services supplied by Manipal Utility Packaging Solutions Pvt Ltd (herein after
referred as MUPSPL) under this invoice are subject to the following terms and conditions (forms an
integral part of this invoice) unless specifically agreed otherwise in writing:

1. Products once sold cannot be returned, except for quality issues, if any.

2. MUPSPL’s responsibility ceases when products have been handed over to your carrier/carrier’s
representative, unless agreed otherwise in writing.

3. Quality issues, if any have to be communicated to MUPSPL, in writing or by e-mail not later than 48
hours of receipt of material by the Customer or his Agent, failing which material is deemed to be as
per agreed specifications as stated in the Customer’s Purchase Order. For issues reported after 48
hours, MUPSPL shall not be liable for any claims towards the Customer or his Agent.

4. Notwithstanding anything contained contrary anywhere in this invoice, under no circumstances the
maximum liability of MUPSPL shall be more than actual monies received by MUPSPL under this
invoice or actual amount of direct damages or loss suffered by the Customer, whichever is lower,
due to defect in the Product so delivered.

5. All statutory levies such as CGST, SGST, IGST or other applicable taxes of similar nature if any, which
may be levied or becomes leviable under any legislation for the time being in force or enacted
hereafter, shall be payable by customer in addition to the price charged by MUPSPL, unless agreed
otherwise in writing.

6. Any statutory form(s) as applicable should be sent to MUPSPL immediately on receipt of this invoice,
failing which differential tax/duty as applicable will be charged to the customer, with
interest/penalty/fee levied by the respective authorities. Customer is bound to pay this amount
immediately.

7. All payments are to be made to Manipal Utility Packaging Solutions Private Limited, by Demand
Drafts/Crossed Cheques. Payments can also be made by NEFT/SWIFT, details as given in the Invoice.
Invoicing detail for amount transferred has to be informed by email to
info.mupsp!|@manipalgroup.info, failing which amount will not be appropriated to Customer’s A/c
against the invoices.

8. The full payment of this invoice shall fall due 15 days from the date of invoice. Interest @ 2.00% per
month or part thereof will be charged on all overdue invoices from the date of invoice for the
delayed payment, apart from the processing fee. In case of advance payment, Tax liability on such
advance payment shall be adjusted with the final settlement.

9. Any part payment made against this invoice shall be treated as “On Account Payment”, unless the
amount of invoice is paid in full.

10. All disputes arising out of this invoice shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of Courts at Udupi,
Karnataka.

11. Clarification on this invoice, if any, shall be raised by the customer in writing within 7 days of receipt
of the invoice. If nothing is heard from the customer, within the said 7 days it will be presumed that
the customer has confirmed the correctness of invoice and the Invoice shall be treated as final and
binding.

___12. TDS certificate for deduction af Income Tax if any will have to be submitted within the statutory due
“datés-for the relevant quart & reported promptly to Income Tax authorities, failing which TDS
“ amount shall beth ed outstgnding and shall be due & payable to MUPSPL.

Text2:
Purchase Order No: 1900002905

Dated : 24-AUG-2018

General Instructions:

1. Receipt of goods from Monday to Saturday from 8.00 AM to 5.00 PM or as agreed upon.

2. The invoice material description should be same as our purchase order material description.

3. Quantity supplied by you should not exceed the quantity mentioned in the purchase order.

4. Please quote purchase order number and date in all your correspondence.

5. Our bankers address: State bank Of Hyderabad, PMR complex, Opp to Corporation office, Tirupati-5 17507, Ph-0877-220153.

6. In case of Excisable goods, Excise gate pass should be sent along with material.

7. Supplier should ensure that material supplied confirms to statutory & regulatory requirements.

8. Supplier should acknowledge receipt of purchase order and agreement of terms mentioned in purchase order. It is considered that all

purchase order terms are accepted unless otherwise specified in writing by the supplier with in seven days.

9. If the item is age-sensitive the supplier shall clearly mention the date of manufacturing and shelf-life. The available shelf-life shall be

more than 50% of material shelf-life from the date of dispatch.

10. In case of any denial/disallowance of Cenvat/Service tax credit and any penalty and/or interest on account of improper documents

from the vendor shall be borne by the vendor only.

11. Purchase or number and line serial number should be mentioned in the Invoice.

12. Our contact person should be informed of the date of dispatch of the material one day in advance.

13. Invoice number should be mentioned in all test reports.

14. Material should be packed in proper packing method as agreed.

15. The consignor need to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Central

Motor Vehicle Rules. 1989 and there after amendments - specifically pertaining to transportation of goods of dangerous or hazardous

]

L

say

16. The SaaS: casita —_— that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Gas

Cylinder Rules, 2004 and there after amendments specifically pertaining to general provisions under chapter II from Rule 3 to 28.

17. All the transport vehicles need to comply to the emission norms specified by Central Motor Vehicle Rules, 189 and need to obtain

.

renewed emission certificate issued by the competent authority.

18. All the transport vehicles in Amara Raja premises should follow the traffic rules strictly and the speed limit should be less than

20kmph.

19. Electronic Way Bill (e-Way Bill) is mandatory for all Interstate purchase transactions. Please get e -Way Bill from buyers before

dispatch the material through online by providing the necessary details and Amara Raja is not responsible for any material struck in CTO

office / on the way to Amara Raja.

Order Accepted

For SIVA SAI ENTERPRISES

For AMARA RAJA BATTERIES LIMITED

uthorized Signatory

Authorized Signatory

E&OE

(Subject to Tirupati Jurisdiction)

Text:
Purchase Order No: 1900003013 Dated : 31-AUG-2018

 

General Instructions:

1. Receipt of goods from Monday to Saturday from 8.00 AM to 5.00 PM or as agreed upon.

2. The invoice material description should be same as our purchase order material description.

3. Quantity supplied by you should not exceed the quantity mentioned in the purchase order.

4, Please quote purchase order number and date in all your correspondence.

5. Our bankers address: State bank Of Hyderabad, PMR complex, Opp to Corporation office, Tirupati-517507, Ph-0877-220153.

6. In case of Excisable goods, Excise gate pass should be sent along with material.

7. Supplier should ensure that material supplied confirms to statutory & regulatory requirements.

8. Supplier should acknowledge receipt of purchase order and agreement of terms mentioned in purchase order. It is considered that all
purchase order terms are accepted unless otherwise specified in writing by the supplier with in seven days.

9. If the item is age-sensitive the supplier shall clearly mention the date of manufacturing and shelf-life. The available shelf-life shall be
more than 50% of material shelf-life from the date of dispatch.

10. In case of any denial/disallowance of Cenvat/Service tax credit and any penalty and/or interest on account of improper documents
from the vendor shall be borne by the vendor only.

11. Purchase or number and line serial number should be mentioned in the Invoice.

12. Our contact person should be informed of the date of dispatch of the material one day in advance.

13. Invoice number should be mentioned in all test reports.

14. Material should be packed in proper packing method as agreed.

15. The consignor need to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Central
Motor Vehicle Rules. 1989 and there after amendments - specifically pertaining to transportation of goods of dangerous or hazardous

qatursie Aumad ite irom Rice 126 te 137.

16. The consignor needs to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Gas
Cylinder Rules, 2004 and there after amendments specifically pertaining to general provisions under chapter II from Rule 3 to 28.

17. All the transport vehicles need to comply to the emission norms specified by Central Motor Vehicle Rules, 189 and need to obtain
renewed emission certificate issued by the competent authority.

18. All the transport vehicles in Amara Raja premises should follow the traffic rules strictly and the speed limit should be less than
20kmph.

19. Electronic Way Bill (e-Way Bill) is mandatory for all Interstate purchase transactions. Please get e -Way Bill from buyers before
dispatch the material through online by providing the necessary details and Amara Raja is not responsible for any material struck in CTO
office / on the way to Amara Raja.
Order Accepted

For Green Power Solutions

   

For AMARA RAJA BATTERIES LIMITE

Authorized Signatory Authorized Signatory

 

ESOE (Subject to Tirupati Jurisdiction)

Purchase Order No: 1900002523 Dated : 01-AUG-2018

General Instructions:

1. Receipt of goods from Monday to Saturday from 8.00 AM to 5.00 PM or as agreed upon.

2. The invoice material description should be same as our purchase order material description.

3. Quantity supplied by you should not exceed the quantity mentioned in the purchase order.

4. Please quote purchase order number and date in all your correspondence.

5. Our bankers address: State bank Of Hyderabad, PMR complex, Opp to Corporation office, Tirupati-517507, Ph-0877-220153.

6. In case of Excisable goods, Excise gate pass should be sent along with material.

7. Supplier should ensure that material supplied confirms to statutory & regulatory requirements.

8. Supplier should acknowledge receipt of purchase order and agreement of terms mentioned in purchase order. It is considered that all
purchase order terms are accepted unless otherwise specified in writing by the supplier with in seven days.

9. If the item is age-sensitive the supplier shall clearly mention the date of manufacturing and shelf-life. The available shelf-life shall be
more than 50% of material shelf-life from the date of dispatch.

10. In case of any denial/disallowance of Cenvat/Service tax credit and any penalty and/or interest on account of improper documents
from the vendor shall be borne by the vendor only.

11. Purchase or number and line serial number should be mentioned in the Invoice.

12. Our contact person should be informed of the date of dispatch of the material one day in advance.

13. Invoice number should be mentioned in all test reports.

14, Material should be packed in proper packing method as agreed.
15. The consignor need to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Central

Motor Vehicle Rules, 1989 and there after amendments - specifically pertaining to transportation of goods of dangerous or hazardous
nature to human life from Rule 129 to 137.

16. The consignor needs to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Gas
Cylinder Rules, 2004 and there after amendments specifically pertaining to general provisions under chapter II from Rule 3 to 28.

17. All the transport vehicles need to comply to the emission norms specified by Central Motor Vehicle Rules, 189 and need to obtain

renewed emission certificate issued by the competent authority.
18. All the transport vehicles in Amara Raja premises should follow the traffic rules strictly and the speed limit should be less than

20kmph.
19, Electronic Way Bill (e-Way Bill) is mandatory for all Interstate purchase transactions. Please get e -Way Bill from buyers before

dispatch the material through online by providing the necessary details and Amara Raja is not responsible for any material struck in CTO
office / on the way to Amara Raja.

Order Accepted

For ATC Telecom Infrastructure Pvt Ltd For AMARA RAJA BATTERIES LIMITED

H

4. Please quote purchase order number and date in all your correspondence.

5. Our bankers address: State bank Of Hyderabad, PMR complex, Opp to Corporation office, Tirupati-517507, Ph-0877-220153.

6. In case of Excisable goods, Excise gate pass should be sent along with material.

7. Supplier should ensure that material supplied confirms to statutory & regulatory requirements.

8. Supplier should acknowledge receipt of purchase order and agreement of terms mentioned in purchase order. It is considered that all

purchase order terms are accepted unless otherwise specified in writing by the supplier with in seven days.

9. If the item is age-sensit

ive the supplier shall clearly mention the date of manufacturing and shelf-life. The available shelf-life shall be

more than 50% of material shelf-life from the date of dispatch.

10. In case of any denial/disallowance of Cenvat/Service tax credit and any penalty and/or interest on account of improper documents

from the vendor shall be borne by the vendor only.

11. Purchase or number and line serial number should be mentioned in the Invoice.

12. Our contact person should be informed of the date of dispatch of the material one day in advance.

13. Invoice number should be mentioned in all test reports.

14, Material should be packed in proper packing method as agreed.

15. The consignor need to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Central

Motor Vehicle Rules, 1989 and there after amendments - specifically pertaining to transportation of goods of dangerous or hazardous

nature to human life from Rule 129 to 137.

16. The consignor needs to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Gas

Cylinder Rules, 2004 and there after amendments specifically pertaining to general provisions under chapter II from Rule 3 to 28.

17. All the transport vehicles need to comply to the emission norms specified by Central Motor Vehicle Rules, 189 and need to obtain

renewed emission certificate issued by the competent authority.

18. All the transport vehicles in Amara Raja premises should follow the traffic rules strictly and the speed limit should be less than

20kmph.

19, Electronic Way Bill (e-Way Bill) is mandatory for all Interstate purchase transactions. Please get e -Way Bill from buyers before

dispatch the material through online by providing the necessary details and Amara Raja is not responsible for any material struck in CTO

office / on the way to Amara Raja.

General Instructions:
1. Receipt of goods from Monday to Saturday from 8.00 AM to 5.00 PM or as agreed upon.

2. The invoice material description should be same as our purchase order material description.

3. Quantity supplied by you should not exceed the quantity mentioned in the purchase order.

4. Please quote purchase order number and date in all your correspondence.

5. Our bankers address: State bank Of Hyderabad, PMR complex, Opp to Corporation office, Tirupati-517507, Ph-0877-220153.
6. In case of Excisable goods, Excise gate pass should be sent along with material.

7. Supplier should ensure that material supplied confirms to statutory & regulatory requirements.

8. Supplier should acknowledge receipt of purchase order and agreement of terms mentioned in purchase order.
purchase order terms are accepted unless otherwise specified in writing by the supplier with in seven days.

9, If the item is age-sensitive the supplier shall clearly mention the date of manufacturing and shelf-life. The available shelf-life shall be

more than 50% of material shelf-life from the date of dispatch.
10. In case of any denial/disallowance of Cenvat/Service tax credit and any penalty and/or interest on account of improper documents

from the vendor shall be borne by the vendor only.

11. Purchase or number and line serial number should be mentioned in the Invoice.

12. Our contact person should be informed of the date of dispatch of the material one day in advance.

13. Invoice number should be mentioned in all test reports.

14. Material should be packed in proper packing method as agreed,

15. The consignor need to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per
Motor Vehicle Rules, 1989 and there after amendments - specifically pertaining to transportation of goods of dangerous or hazardous
nature to human life from Rule 129 to 137.

16. The consignor needs to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisi
Cylinder Rules, 2004 and there after amendments specifically pertaining to general provisions under chapter II from Rule 3 to 28.

17. All the transport vehicles need to comply to the emission norms specified by Central Motor Vehicle Rules, 189 and need to obtain
renewed emission certificate issued by the competent authority.

18. All the transport vehicles in Amara Raja premises should follow the traffic rules strictly and the speed limit should be less than
20kmph.

19. Electronic Way
dispatch the material through online by providing the necessary details and Amara Raja is not res

6. In case of Excisable goods, Excise gate pass should be sent along with material.
7. Supplier should ensure that material supplied confirms to statutory & regulatory requirements.
8. Supplier should acknowledge receipt of purchase order and agreement of terms mentioned in purchase order. It is considered that all
purchase order terms are accepted unless otherwise specified in writing by the supplier with in seven days.
9, If the item is age-sensitive the supplier shall clearly mention the date of manufacturing and shelf-life. The available shelf-life shall be
more than 50% of material shelf-life from the date of dispatch.
10. In case of any denial/disallowance of Cenvat/Service tax credit and any penalty and/or interest on account of improper documents
from the vendor shall be borne by the vendor only.
11. Purchase or number and line serial number should be mentioned in the Invoice.
12. Our contact person should be informed of the date of dispatch of the material one day in advance.
13. Invoice number should be mentioned in all test reports.
14. Material should be packed in proper packing method as agreed,
15. The consignor need to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Central
Motor Vehicle Rules, 1989 and there after amendments - specifically pertaining to transportation of goods of dangerous or hazardous
nature to human life from Rule 129 to 137.
16. The consignor needs to ensure that the consignor/transporter is following the relevant requirements as per the provisions of Gas
Cylinder Rules, 2004 and there after amendments specifically pertaining to general provisions under chapter II from Rule 3 to 28.
17. All the transport vehicles need to comply to the emission norms specified by Central Motor Vehicle Rules, 189 and need to obtain
renewed emission certificate issued by the competent authority.
18. All the transport vehicles in Amara Raja premises should follow the traffic rules strictly and the speed limit should be less than
20kmph.
19. Electronic Way Bill (e-Way Bill) is mandatory for all Interstate purchase transactions. Please get € -Way Bill from buyers before
dispatch the material through online by providing the necessary details and Amara Raja is not responsible for any material struck in CTO
office / on the way to Amara Raja.
Order Accepted
For GEE Power For AMARA RAJA BATTERIES LIMITED
Authorized Signatory a
E&OE (Subject to Tirupati Jurisdiction)

Sir,

We are herewith enclosing the coupons of the consumption of Diesel and Petrol

from Oist Oct 2018 to 31st Oct 2018 for your vehicles. We kindly request you

to give cheque/DD in favour of “MOHAN'S” for the total amount of Rs.
FEST (D

Thanking you,

Yours faithfully,

For MOHANS

 

Authorized Signatory.

Note:
1 .Payment by way of cheques or Demand Drafts(DD) to be made in favour of
“MOHAN'S.Cheques would be subject to realization.Once dishonoured only
DD or cash only be accepted.

2. Payment should be received by 10" of each month in which bills are issued.
If not paid before the 10" of every month, supplies will be stopped to your
vehicles and credit account will be permanently closed.

3. Any queries required regarding this bill must be enquired within 10 days of
the billed date.

4.We would be levying a late payment fee of 2 % on the previous
months outstanding amounts if not remitted before 10" of every
month.

5.Coupons books would be issued from 10 am to 4 pm from Monday to
Friday with the prior intimation(2days in advance) of requirement .

6.Fuel would be given only to those who have coupons on hand. No
recommendations would be acceptable .

<

i TERMS AND CONDITIONS ’

i’ ~

Ol. The Consignor hereby deciares that the goods mentioned overieat, hereinafter referred fo as consignment, does not contain any prohibited or contraband articles and they have compiled with all
the statutory regulations relating to the movement of goods.

02. The Consignor Is responsible for entrustment of proper documents to the driver of the vehicle and for all consequences due to any Incorrect or false declarations of value of contents
of the Consignment. :

03. Amara Road Lines, hereinafter referred to as the Transporter agreed fo transport the goods as instructed overleaf as packed at Owner's Risk and fo deliver the goods In the like order and conditions
as received, subject to any deterioration in the condition thereof resulting from natural causes like effect of temperature, weather condition, etc., to the consignee.

04. The Transporter shall no t be liable for any loss or damage to the consignment due to pliferage, theft, weather conditions, strikes, riots, disturbances fire explosions, accidents provided however ¢
reasonable precautions are taken fo provide against such contingencies.

05. The transporter does not guarantee delivery within any specified time and the transporter shall not be liable for any in delivery due to any reason.

06. In the case of godown delivery, delivery of goods should be taken from transporter godown within 15 days of the arrival of the consignment and for every day of delay in clearing the Consignment
3 palse per kg will be collected from the consignee and it would be the responsibility of the consignee and consignor fo ascertain the date and time of arrival of the Consignment at the destination
consignor.

07. in the case of direct delivery to the consignee, If the consignee refuses to take delivery of the Consignment even after 48 hours from the time of arrival at their premises, the transporter shall
have right to dispose off the Consignment after due notice (48 hours in the case of perishables or 30 days in the case of other goods, on to retum the Consignment back to consignor at the cost
of the consignor.

08. When the goods covered by the consignment Note have been lost, destroyed damaged or have deteriorated, the compensation payable by the transporter, if any, shall not exceed the value declared
in the consignment note subject to providing proof to the value declared. Necessary claim certificate will be issued.

09. The transporter shall not be responsible if the consignment Is seized or confiscated by Governmental authorities for reasons beyond our control.

10. The Transporter shail have the right to entrust the consignment to any of their agents or to any other carrier, transporter or vehicle owner for transprotation. However, the primary responsibility for the
transportation shall lie with the transporter. 5

11. No enquiry will be entertained relating to any consignment after the expiry of 30 days from the date of delivery.

12. No sult shall be filed against the transporter in respect of any consignment without a written claim preferred within 30 days from the date of booking or the date of arrival.

T3. Any expenses Incurred by the transporter due to the absence of defiency of records or incorrect or false declaration about the nature of the Consignmnet will be fully reimbursed by the Consignor.

14. In case of transport of goods on to pay basis, the consignor or consignee will be jointly and severally liable to pay the frieght charges.

15. All payments of freights should be made by the customer </ consignor or consignee only to the transporter and not to the driver unless it is authorised by the transporter inwritting.

16. The courts in Chittoor alone shall have jurisdiction in respect of all claims and matters arising under this consignment note or of the goods entrusted for tranport.

Consignee's Acknowledgement

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

we

~

01.

The consignor hereby declares that the goods mentioned overleaf, hereinafter reffered to as Consignment, does not contain any prohibited or contraband articles and they have complied with all the statutory’regulations

relating to the movement of goods.

ee

*

¢e

02

The Consignor is responsible for entrustment of proper documents to the driver of the vehicle and for all consequences due to any incorrect or false declaration of value of contents of the Consignment.

' ~

_

™

et

4

03.

.

as received

KAMALAMMA TRANSPORT here in after referred to as the company, agreed to transport the goods as instructed overieaf as packed at Owner's Risk and to deliver the goods in the like order and condition

‘

Subject

to any deterioration in the condition thereof resulting from natural causes like effect of temperature, Weather condition, Etc.,to the consignee

04.

riots

.

How ever all reasonable

The Transporter shall not be liable for any loss or damage to the Consignment due to pilferage, Theft, Weather conditions,

Strikes,

’

disturbances,

Fire explosions,

accidents provided

precautions are taken to provide against such contingencies.

}

'

05

The Transporter does not guarantee delivery with in any specified time and the company shall not be liable for any delay in delivery due to any reason.

ie

06.

In the case of godown delivery, delivery of goods should be taken from company's godown with in 15 days of the arrival of the consignment and for every days of delay in clearing the consignment 3 paise per Kg will be

collected from the consignee and it would be the responsibility of the consignee and consignor to ascertain the date and time of arrival of the Consignment at the destination branch.

07

In the case of direct delivery to the consignee, if the Consignee refuses to take delivery of the consignment even after 48 hours from the time of arrival at their premises. The company shall have the right to dispose off

the consignment after due notice (48 hours in the case of perishables or 30 days in the case of other goods) to return the consignment back to Consignor at the cost of the consignor.

08.

When the goods covered by the consignment Note have beem lost, destroyed, damaged or have deteriorated, the compensation payable by the company, if any, shall not exceed the value declared in the

consignment Note subject to Providing proof to the value declared

0

9

The Transporter shall not be responsible if the Consignment is seized or confiscated by Government authorities for reasons beyond our control

.

10.

The Transporter shall have the right to entrust the consignment to any of their agents or to any other carrier, transporter or vehicle owner for transportation. However, the primary responsibility for the transportation

shall lie with the Transporter.

.

f

te

11

No enquiry will be entertained relating to any Consignment after the expiry of 30 days from the date of Delivery

12.

No suit shall be filed against the company in respect of any Consignment without a written claim preferred with in 30 days from the date of booking or the date of arrival

13

Any expenses incurred by the company due to the absence or deficiency of records or incorrect or false declaration about the nature of the consignment will be fully reimbursed by the consignor.

14.

In case of transport of goods on to-pay basis, the consignor or consignee will be jointly and severally liable to pay the freight charges.

io:

All payments of freights should be made by the customer or consignor or consignee only to the company and not to the driver unless it is authorised by the company in writing

16

The courts in Chennai city alone shall have Jurisdiction in respect of all claims and matters arising under this Consignment Note or of the goods entrusted for transport

‘
